headline: Deckers (NYSE:DECK) Surprises With Q2 Sales, Stock Soars
summary: Footwear and apparel conglomerate Deckers (NYSE:DECK) announced better-than-expected revenue in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 16.9% year on year to $964.5 million. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $1.4 million was less impressive, coming in 99.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its GAAP profit of $0.93 per share was 36.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

Its GAAP profit of $0.93 per share was 36.6% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Deckers (DECK) Tops Q1 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Deckers (DECK) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +36.76% and +7.29%, respectively, for the quarter ended June 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Deckers shares surge 11% on Q1 beat driven by strong HOKA and UGG sales
summary: Investing.com -- Deckers Brands reported stronger-than-expected first-quarter earnings, driven by strong demand for its HOKA and UGG brands, sending its shares more than 11% higher in premarket trading Friday.

headline: Deckers Stock Surges After Hoka and Ugg Fuel Q1 Beat
summary: Net sales increased 16.9 percent in Q1 to $964.5 million compared to $825.3 million the same time last year.

headline: Deckers First-Quarter Results Fly on Higher Hoka, Ugg Sales
summary: EARNINGS   Deckers Outdoor’s financial results jumped in its fiscal first quarter as Hoka and Ugg shoes boosted sales. The footwear and apparel company on Thursday posted net income of $139.2 million, or 93 cents a share, in the quarter ended June 30, compared with $115.

raw.headline: Deckers First-Quarter Results Fly on Higher Hoka, Ugg Sales
raw.summary: EARNINGS   Deckers Outdoor’s financial results jumped in its fiscal first quarter as Hoka and Ugg shoes boosted sales. The footwear and apparel company on Thursday posted net income of $139.2 million, or 93 cents a share, in the quarter ended June 30, compared with $115.

headline: Hoka-parent Deckers beats quarterly estimates boosted by demand in Europe, China
summary: Deckers has been rapidly expanding its international presence, in an effort to counter choppy U.S. demand after several years of strong growth.  Similar to rivals such as Nike and Skechers, Deckers relies heavily on Vietnam as a key manufacturing hub.

headline: Deckers Brands Nominates Patrick J. Grismer to Board of Directors
summary: GOLETA, Calif., July 24, 2025--Deckers Brands (NYSE: DECK), a global leader in designing, marketing, and distributing innovative footwear, apparel, and accessories, today announced the nomination of Patrick J. Grismer for election to its Board of Directors (the "Board") at the Company’s 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on September 8, 2025 (the "Annual Meeting"). headline: Deckers Brands Reports First Quarter Fiscal Year 2026 Financial Results
summary: GOLETA, Calif., July 24, 2025--Deckers Brands (NYSE: DECK), a global leader in designing, marketing, and distributing innovative footwear, apparel, and accessories, today announced financial results for the first fiscal quarter ended June 30, 2025. The Company also provided its financial outlook for the second fiscal quarter ending September 30, 2025.

The Company also provided its financial outlook for the second fiscal quarter ending September 30, 2025.
